title: Google's in TROUBLE...

transcript: What is love Baby don't tech news, no more - After being threatened with antitrust lawsuits from basically every government ever, Google is finally getting sued by the US Department of Justice. The case centers around Google Search and it's completely dominant position in the search engine market. But being dominant isn't enough to justify an antitrust lawsuit. The government is using the fact that Google pays billions of dollars a year to companies in exchange for pre installing Google Search on their devices and preferring it over competitors like DuckDuckGo, which only further solidifies Google's powerful position. So it's about distribution. To be fair, there's a reason Google has become synonymous with online search. It's that, Ask Jeeves sucks. And so does Bing. It's unclear what will come of this legal conflict, but similar cases against Google in the EU have resulted in fines and changes to the way the company bundles Android services. Although the EU has a lot more teeth with antitrust. So maybe this is just election prop like, posturing, I don't know. We could also see absolutely nothing happened. And, if you're like these cards aren't even gonna be good, James, yer numpty, well, I resent that. And you might be so wrong.
